He posits that shifting the focus to place as the central organizing principle can lead to a more grounded and meaningful community. The film, which starred Jamie Lee Curtis as a babysitter terrorized by a psychopath, grossed over $60 million worldwide, a record for an independent film at the time. Hill also collaborated with Carpenter on the films Escape from New York and The Fog.

Born in New Jersey, Hill began her career in the film industry as a production assistant and worked her way up the ranks, eventually becoming an assistant director and second-unit director. She was widely regarded as a pioneering woman in the film industry, breaking ground in the 1970s by taking on roles that were typically held by men.

Hill's legacy in the horror genre continues to be celebrated, and her contributions to the genre are still widely recognized today. Her work on Halloween helped establish Carpenter as a major horror director, and the film's enduring popularity has cemented Hill's place in horror history.

This paper presents a millimeter-scale CMOS 64$\times$64 single charged particle radiation detector system for external beam cancer radiotherapy. Online reviews provide valuable insights for customers when making purchasing decisions. Entanglement is a crucial resource for quantum information processing. However, as the number of parties involved in the system increases, it becomes increasingly challenging to develop an efficient entanglement witness for general multipartite entangled states. For $n$-partite Greenberger-Horne-Zeilinger (GHZ)-like states, the most robust witness scheme requires $n+1$ local measurement settings and can tolerate up to $1/2$ white noise. As a comparison, the most efficient witness for GHZ-like states requires only two local measurement settings and can tolerate up to $1/3$ white noise.

These spacetimes can break the axial and equatorial symmetry of the Kerr metric, resulting in a richer multipolar structure that serves as a portal to constrain fuzzball models phenomenologically. Our analysis reveals that the multipole moments of these spacetimes are typically larger in absolute value than those of a Kerr black hole with the same mass and spin. Current measurements of the quadrupole moment of black-hole candidates provide only mild constraints on fuzzballs, but future gravitational-wave detections of extreme mass-ratio inspirals with the Lisa mission will significantly improve these bounds by orders of magnitude.

Understanding how strongly correlated two-dimensional (2d) systems can give rise to unconventional superconductivity with high critical temperatures is one of the major unsolved problems in condensed matter physics. Ultracold 2d fermi gases have emerged as clean and controllable model systems to study the interplay of strong correlations and reduced dimensionality, but direct evidence of superfluidity in these systems has been missing. Here, we demonstrate superfluidity in an ultracold 2d fermi gas by moving a periodic potential through the system and observing no dissipation below a critical velocity, v$_{\rm c}$, we measure v$_{\rm c}$ as a function of interaction strength and find a maximum in the crossover regime between bosonic and fermionic superfluidity. Metal ion implantation into ceramics has been shown to be an effective and controllable technique for tailoring the surface electrical conductivity of the ceramic piece, and this approach has been applied in a number of applications. One of the key advantages of this method is that it allows for grading the voltage drop across high voltage insulators, thereby increasing the maximum operational voltage that can be applied across the insulator without the risk of surface flashover. However, a concern with this method is the long-term stability of the implantation-induced conductivity, particularly if the implanted metal species is prone to oxidation. In this study, we investigate the long-term behavior of the surface conductivity of titanium-implanted alumina. Our results show that the conductivity initially drops by as much as 40% in the first few weeks after implantation, but then only decreases at a rate of about 10% over the following year.

We propose a novel skyrmion-like conserved current in the effective theory of pions and vector mesons based on the idea of hidden local symmetry. The associated charge is equivalent to the skyrmion charge for any smooth configuration. In addition, there exist singular configurations that can be identified as $n_f=1$ baryons charged under the new symmetry. Under this identification, the vector mesons play the role of the chern-Simons vector fields living on the quantum Hall droplet that forms the $n_f=1$ baryon. We suggest that this current is the correct effective expression for the baryon current at low energies.
